intro: Peyritschia virletii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved peyritschia, is a rare and unique plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Peyritschia virletii is considered a species of conservation concern.
